result.execSummary:
The defendant David M. Lewandowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).
  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $268.00  plus $250.00  DNA and $5000.00 image fee  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Any prison funds to be used to pay debt.

13 years prison  4 years initial confinement followed by 9 years on extended supervision
Court expects Department of Corrections to get Defendant into programming both Critical Thinking and Sex offender in soon enough that the defendant is able to take advantage of Statute 973.195 (early release).

superMiscConds.notes: no Internet use or access except those allowed by DOC restrictions to get employment or other legitimate uses; not to possess any pornographic material; not to have any contact with minors without parents prior permission; must comply with sex offender rules.

Court sentences DEF on CT#3 to 13 years prison  4 years initial confinement followed by 9 years on extended supervision, credit for 271 days -  court costs $268.00 and DNA surcharge $250.00  - Court expects Department of Corrections to get Defendant into programming both Critical Thinking and Sex offender in soon enough that the defendant is able to take advantage of Statute 973.195 (early release).   conditions of extended supervision  -  no Internet use or access except those allowed by DOC restrictions to get employment or other legitimate uses; not to possess any pornographic material; not to have any contact with minors without parents prior permission; must comply with sex offender rules.

Defendant David M. Lewandowski in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Defendant David M. Lewandowski in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counts 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10 are dismissed but read-in.   Defendant requests PSI; long form PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant David M. Lewandowski in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant pleads NC to Ct. 1, 2, & 3; court convicts and finds guilty on Ct. 1, 2, & 3.   Questions regarding Ct. 4-10.  Bail revoked on courts motion.  Adjourned plea hearing scheduled for December 18, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant David M. Lewandowski in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Defendant David M. Lewandowski in custody.  Bruce R. Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. have agreement, set for dispo  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant David M. Lewandowski in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Bruce R. Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Acknowledges receipt of information; advised of rights; pleads NG Ct. 1 - 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant David M. Lewandowski in court with attorney Michael C Hoffman.  Defendant David M. Lewandowski in custody.  Bruce R Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DEF waives preliminary hearing, court binds over for trial, bond continues,  Arraignment scheduled for September 2, 2014 at 10:00 am.
No contact with any person under 18 years of age; no computer access, may not possess a computer, shall not access the internet through any device.  (combined cash bond $3,000 / signature $7,000)
No contact with any person under 18 years of age; no computer access, may not possess a computer, shall not access the internet through any device. (combined $3,000 cash / $7,000 signature)

$10,000 bond---($3,000 cash component and $7,000 signature component) 
Conditions of NO CONTACT with any person under 18 years of age, no computer access, DE must not be in possession of a computer, and DE shall not access the internet through any device.

$10,000 bond---($3,000 cash component and $7,000 signature component) 
Conditions of NO CONTACT with any person under 18 years of age, no computer access, DE must not be in possession of a computer, and DE shall not access the internet through any device.

Defendant David M. Lewandowski in custody and in court via video means, with Attorney James McLaughlin on behalf of Attorney Michael C Hoffman.  John M Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint.  Attorney McLaughlin argued motion to modify bond, argued DE had no criminal history and has strong ties to Hayward.  State argues does not want to change bond as it leaves no protection for public, there are more than 10 victims and high likelihood DE would be a flight risk to leave jurisdiction considering the pending charges.  Rebuttal---he was arrested while in the community, not in flight, and our court system hinges on a presumption of innocence.  

Court modified bond to $10,000 bond ($3,000 cash component, $7,000 signature component) with conditions of: NO CONTACT with any person under 18 years of age, no computer access, DE must not be in possession of a computer, and DE shall not access the internet through any device.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 24, 2014 at 10:45 am.
Shall not have access to internet through any device.
Shall not have access to internet through any device.

District Attorney Bruce Poquette appeared in person. Defendant appeared in court in custody by video. Cash bond set at $10,000 with condition not to have access to internet through any device.  Court reset to 06-24-14 at 8:30.
